json_manager module¶

json_manager.append_import_to_file(entries, filename)[source]¶

Method to append to the file “Import” zone, which will add in the “Import” section the needed entries

Parameters: entries (array of json): Entries that will be append into the file filename (String): Name of the file

Returns: nothing

@author: Álvaro García Infante

json_manager.conf(term)[source]¶

This methods is used to get the specific paths of the apache folder to run the commands

Parameters: term (String): Term that will be checked for keywords in case it needs to change a path

Returns: string: the term corrected with the actual path

@author: Álvaro García Infante

json_manager.export_into(list, filename)[source]¶

Export list of commands into the file

Parameters: list (list): List of commands that will be exported filename (String): Name of the file that will receive the commands

Returns: nothing

@author: Álvaro García Infante

json_manager.file = 'comandosApacheWindows.json'¶

This module is used to work with the json files and help other modules that need this task.

json_manager.get_all_modules()[source]¶

Get all the modules as a list

Parameters: none

Returns: list: Return all the modules of the system as a list

@author: Álvaro García Infante

json_manager.get_modules(module_to_use)[source]¶

Get all the modules as a list, which name is the same as the parameter

Parameters: module_to_use (string): The module which name is used to extract th

Returns: list: Returns the modules that are inside the module which is the parameter

@author: Álvaro García Infante

json_manager.get_modules_json()[source]¶

Get the modules from the json file of the commands

Parameters: none

Returns: dict:All the modules that are inside the json file

@author: Álvaro García Infante

json_manager.import_into(command_list, filename)[source]¶

Import command list into the json file

Parameters: command_list (list): List of commands that will be imported filename (String): Name of the file that the commands will be imported into

Returns: none

@author: Álvaro García Infante

json_manager.write_new_command(name, desc, comando)[source]¶

This method will write the new command into the JSON file

Parameters: name (String): Name of the command that needs to be written desc (String): Description of the command comando (String): Actual command that will be run

Returns: nothing

@author: Álvaro García Infante

DSL (Lenguaje de Dominio Específico) para configurar un servidor de forma segura
